main.tagline: Comparing Mankar with other sprayer products

setting.help: Please feel free to adjust the pricing to see the effect on the overall costs of weed control.
Please note this is area sprayed, not total land area.
How many times, per year, that you will apply herbicide.
Over how many years are you writing off this machine? Usually people say 5 years, although the machine might last far longer.
How much does labour cost you per hour? Since the calculations take into account time spent refilling the unit, you can put the true hourly rate here.
You can walk much faster with a Mankar sprayer because it has a uniform spray pattern, is lighter, and required no pumping to build pressure.
Herbicide application rate in either litres per hectare (l/ha) or gallons per acre (gpa).

metric.title: Total Cost per Year
metric.explanation: This is your total projected spraying cost per year based on the variables entered above. A more detailed explanation is provided below. Feel free to play with the settings to see how they affect the results.

metric.title: Purchase Price
metric.explanation: Purchase price has remarkably little effect on the accumulative total cost of spraying. Try changing the purchase price of either unit - you'll see that most costs of spraying come from the auxilliary costs of labor and consumables. Mankar sprayers may be a bigger upfront investment, but they will earn it back by the end of the season.

metric.title: Spraying Hours per Year
metric.explanation: Total spraying hours per year. This excludes every other activity - for example refilling or coffee breaks. This is based on your spray area (&&mankar#area&&) and your number of applications per year (&&mankar#applications&&). The difference arises from the different spray widths as well as different walking speeds.

metric.title: Refills per Hectare
metric.explanation: This variable is based on the size of the tank, application rates, and rates of dilution of the product. Since with the Mankar system there is no dilution of the product, this generally means there are far fewer refills using the Mankar system.

metric.title: Time Spent Refilling
metric.explanation: Since there is no water needed with the Mankar system, refilling is as simple as returning to your jug of herbicide (which you can keep nearby), and filling the small tank. With conventional systems it is a more complicated and time-consuming process: return to a water source, measure the correct amount of herbicide for your mixture, fill the entire tank with water, and agitate.

metric.title: Refill Cost per Hectare
metric.explanation: This is based on how many refills per hectare (Mankar: &&mankar#refills&& Other: &&other#refills&&) multiplied by how many minutes it takes to refill the tank (Mankar: &&mankar#refillTime&& Other: &&other#refillTime&&).

imperial.title: Refill Cost per Acre
imperial.explanation: This is based on how many refills per acre (Mankar: &&mankar#refills&& Other: &&other#refills&&) multiplied by how many minutes it takes to refill the tank (Mankar: &&mankar#refillTime&& Other: &&other#refillTime&&).

metric.title: Manhours per Hectare
metric.explanation: Labor cost per hour ($&&mankar#labour&&) multiplied by spraying time.

imperial.title: Manhours per Acre
imperial.explanation: Labor cost per hour ($&&mankar#labour&&) multiplied by spraying time.

metric.title: Total Cost per Hectare
metric.explanation: This is your total cost for controlling weeds per hectare, per year. This included everything: depreciation, interest, chemicals, spray time, and refill time.

imperial.title: Total Cost per Acre
imperial.explanation: This is your total cost for controlling weeds per acre, per year. This included everything: depreciation, interest, chemicals, spray time, and refill time.

metric.title: Total Cost per Hectare, per Application
metric.explanation: A per hectare, per application breakdown.

imperial.title: Total Cost per Acre, per Application
imperial.explanation: A per acre, per application breakdown.
